Package com.kamikazejam.kamicommon.nms.abstraction.entity

Class EntityMethodsPre_1_13

java.lang.Object
com.kamikazejam.kamicommon.nms.abstraction.entity.AbstractEntityMethods
com.kamikazejam.kamicommon.nms.abstraction.entity.EntityMethodsPre_1_13
public abstract class EntityMethodsPre_1_13 extends AbstractEntityMethods
Pre-1.13 implementation of AbstractEntityMethods that handles spawner item manipulation using NBT data access.

This class provides spawner item handling for Minecraft versions prior to 1.13, where spawner data was stored differently and required direct NBT manipulation. It includes legacy entity type mapping to handle the transition between old NMS names and modern EntityType values.

The implementation uses the NBT-API library to access and modify item NBT data, and includes comprehensive entity type translation for legacy compatibility.

  • Method Details

    • getSpawnerType

      @NotNull public @NotNull Optional<EntityType> getSpawnerType(@Nullable @Nullable ItemStack stack)
      Retrieves the entity type that a spawner item is configured to spawn.

      This method examines a spawner ItemStack and determines what type of entity it will spawn when placed. The method handles version differences in how spawner data is stored.

      This implementation uses NBT data access to retrieve the spawner type from the item's BlockEntityTag compound or legacy type tag.

      Specified by:
      getSpawnerType in class AbstractEntityMethods
      Parameters:
      stack - the spawner ItemStack to examine, may be null
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the EntityType if the stack is a valid spawner, empty otherwise

    • setSpawnerType

      @NotNull public @NotNull ItemStack setSpawnerType(@NotNull @NotNull ItemStack stack, @NotNull @NotNull EntityType type)
      Sets the entity type that a spawner item will spawn.

      This method modifies a spawner ItemStack to spawn the specified entity type when placed. The method handles version differences in how spawner data is stored and applied.

      This implementation uses NBT data modification to set the spawner type in the item's BlockEntityTag compound using the legacy entity naming.

      Specified by:
      setSpawnerType in class AbstractEntityMethods
      Parameters:
      stack - the spawner ItemStack to modify
      type - the EntityType the spawner should spawn
      Returns:
      the modified ItemStack with the new spawner type

    • getSpawnerTypeByNBT

      @NotNull protected @NotNull Optional<EntityType> getSpawnerTypeByNBT(@Nullable @Nullable ItemStack stack)
      Retrieves the spawner type from an ItemStack using NBT data access.

      This method examines the item's NBT data to determine what entity type the spawner will produce. It checks both the BlockEntityTag.EntityId path (standard) and the legacy type tag for backwards compatibility.

      The method includes validation to ensure the item is actually a spawner and contains valid entity data before attempting translation.

      Parameters:
      stack - the ItemStack to examine, may be null
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the EntityType if valid, empty if the stack is invalid or not a spawner

    • setSpawnerTypeByNBT

      protected ItemStack setSpawnerTypeByNBT(ItemStack stack, @NotNull @NotNull EntityType type)
      Sets the spawner type in an ItemStack using NBT data modification.

      This method modifies the item's NBT data to set what entity type the spawner will produce when placed. It creates the necessary BlockEntityTag compound and sets the EntityId using the legacy entity naming scheme.

      Parameters:
      stack - the spawner ItemStack to modify
      type - the EntityType the spawner should produce
      Returns:
      the modified ItemStack, or null if the stack is invalid
